analysis.title: The Mighty Flynn
analysis.author: Lorene Scafaria
analysis.logline: When a ruthless corporate downsizer is fired and his phone number mistakenly listed as the suicide hotline, he must confront the human cost of his callous career through desperate callers seeking help.
analysis.tone: Darkly comic with dramatic emotional beats, cynical yet ultimately hopeful

core_quality.verdict_rationale: Solid professional execution with strong premise and character development. The unique phone mix-up concept and Jimmy's redemption arc are compelling, but pacing and dialogue issues prevent it from reaching RECOMMEND tier.

characters.protagonist: Jimmy Flynn (38) - Ruthless corporate downsizer whose callous efficiency masks deep grief over his dead son. Goal evolves from getting his job back to finding redemption and human connection. Compelling because we see his vulnerability beneath the cruelty.
characters.antagonist: No clear antagonist - story is character-driven internal conflict. Corporate system and Jimmy's own callousness serve as opposing forces.
supporting: Boaty/Jennifer (16) - Resourceful runaway who becomes Jimmy's unlikely conscience, hiding her own pain over her father's suicide
Jerry Babitsky (50s) - Lonely widower toll collector whose calls to the 'hotline' force Jimmy to confront his impact on others
Trish - Jimmy's sister, representing family connection he's abandoned
Brian (23) - Jimmy's former protégé who embodies Jimmy's worst traits

structure_analysis.act_breaks: Act 1 ends page 29 (Jimmy fired and phone mix-up revealed), Act 2 ends page 89 (Jimmy's emotional breakdown in Derwin's office)
structure_analysis.pacing: Strong opening and ending with some sagging in middle during employment agency sequences (pages 45-60). Final act builds effectively to bridge rescue climax.

standout_scenes.scene: Jimmy fires Bowman in front of his daughter
standout_scenes.why: Perfectly establishes Jimmy's callousness while generating sympathy for his victims
Visceral, well-written action that establishes their bond without sentimentality
Emotional climax where Jimmy finally confronts his grief and guilt
Action sequence that demonstrates Jimmy's complete transformation

strengths: Excellent high-concept premise with built-in irony (page 32 revelation)

Make dialogue more naturalistic, reduce exposition

analysis.executive_summary: Well-crafted dark comedy with excellent premise and strong protagonist arc. Jimmy Flynn's transformation from callous downsizer to caring human through suicide hotline mix-up is compelling. Professional execution with minor pacing and dialogue issues.
